result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron L Prather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8-19-16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, child care and elder care. Defendant may not vote in any election until civil rights have been restored. Restitution set at zero. Provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laron L Prather in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 40 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply`for work, child care and elder care.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 8/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 8/19/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Laron L Prather in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 15.    Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Laron L Prather in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court addresses the Violation report.  Defendant had permission to travel to Texas and Justice Point called the defendant on the date that he was to return to Wisconsin.  Defense moves for an adjournment to obtain additional discovery.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Laron L Prather in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Parties may have reached a resolution.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 44.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #1996CM615733 that are attached to the complaint.
Court will allow defendant to travel to Texas to attend a relative's graduation. Defendant will leave 5/23/2014 and return 5/29/2014.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Laron L Prather in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Hanna Kolberg for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/5/14.

14RM022668  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04/26/14 LJ

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Laron L Prather in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Laron L Prather in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
